intro: Periballia minuta subsp. australis, commonly known as the Australian dwarf periballia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Australia. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers during the autumn season. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
